creator: lcf@wp.pl
text:
Apache didn't show anything or produced any errors. When i changed LogLevel
to debug, then i've got messages:

[Fri Mar 07 10:53:02 2003] [debug] .\server\mpm\winnt\child.c(523)
:(OS 10038)An operation was attempted on something that is not a socket.
: winnt_accept: AcceptEx failed due to early client disconnect.
Reallocate the accept socket and try again.

What antivirus/firewall software do you have installed on this machine?  If it's McAfee, this is a 
duplicate of bug #8325.
creator: jwoolley@apache.org

text:
I used McAfee VirusScan Professional 7.0 (firewall deactivated). Moving to 
Apache 2.0.47 and VirusScan 7.03 didn't changed anything. Deactivating McAfee 
software didn't helped, too. Deinstalling it solved problem. Sorry for 
duplicating 8325. Is there any way to make Apache2+McAfee combo working -
Apache1 works fine all the time...
creator: lcf@wp.pl

text:
Sure.  Get McAfee to fix their software.

Sorry, I know that's not very helpful, but McAfee is replacing a 
working TCP stack with a broken one.  There isn't much Apache
can do about it.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8325 ***
creator: slive@apache.org
